column2865: We give him a minute--we give him a minute to answer.
column2867: Give him a minute--a holy minute--say your prayers, Barlow--you've got a minute--tick-tick, says the clock--time him!
column2871: Of all the damned, cowardly--- VOICES.
column2873: Silence is golden, Houghton.--Close the shutters, Willie's dead.--Dry up, wet whiskers!
column2877: There's a long, long trail a-winding--- JOB ARTHUR.
column2878: The minute's up.--We ask you again, Gerald Barlow, why you refused a just and fair demand, when you know it was against the wishes of three thousand men all as good as yourself.
